enWisdom: The ignorant one does not restrain himself [from evil]
The ignorant person does not desist [from sinning]
The ignorant person is deceived by [false] claims

Wisdom: الْعَالِمُ يَنْظُرُ بِقَلْبِهِ وَخَاطِرِهِ وَالْجَاهِلُ يَنْظُرُ بِعَيْنِهِ وَنَاظِرِهِ
enWisdom: The scholar sees with his heart and his mind while the ignorant one sees with his eyes and his eyesight

Wisdom: الْجَاهِلُ إِذَا جَمَدَ وَجَدَ [إِذَا جَحَدَ وَحَّدَ] وَإِذَا وَجَدَ أَلْحَدَ [وحد]
enWisdom: When the ignorant one becomes stingy (or denies), he obtains [wealth] and when he obtains [wealth] (or professes belief in one God), he apostatizes

Wisdom: الْجَاهِلُ لَنْ يُلْقَى [يلغى‏] أَبَداً إِلَّا مُفَرِّطاً أَوْ مُفْرِطاً
enWisdom: The ignorant one is not seen to be anything but immoderate (or excessive)

Wisdom: الْجَاهِلُ لَا يَرْتَدِعُ وَبِالْمَوَاعِظِ [بِالْمَوْعِظَةِ] لَا يَنْتَفِعُ
enWisdom: Neither does an ignorant restrain himself [from wrongdoing] nor does he benefit from good advice

Wisdom: الْجَاهِلُ لَا يَعْرِفُ تَقْصِيرَهُ وَلَا يَقْبَلُ مِنَ النَّصِيحِ لَهُ
enWisdom: An ignorant person does not recognize his failure and does not accept the [good] advice given to him
The wealth of an ignorant person is in his worldly possessions and his hopes
Obedience to the foolish is a sign of ignorance
The punishment of the ignorant is [in the form of open] declaration
The pinnacle of ignorance is for a person to brag about his ignorance

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا حَسُنَتْ نِعْمَةُ الْجَاهِلِ ازْدَادَ قُبْحاً فِيهَا
enWisdom: Whenever the blessing of an ignorant person becomes good, his ugliness in it increases
The language of ignorance is impoliteness
The tongue of the ignorant person is the key to his destruction
How shameless the ignorant one is!
The ignorant one is not seen to be anything but immoderate
